content:
Balangir

Balangir also known as Bolangir, is a city and municipality, the headquarters of Balangir district in the state of Odisha, India. Balangir has a rich cultural heritage. It is also known as the cultural hub of Western Odisha.[1]{"citetype": "web", "url": "http://rtiodisha.gov.in/Department/Culture-Department/33/District-Culture-Office-Bolangir/2723/About-the-Organization/2", "title": "has been designed as a District Culture Centre", "accessdate": "17 January 2013", "archiveurl": "https://web.archive.org/web/20130730121839/http://rtiodisha.gov.in/Department/Culture-Department/33/District-Culture-Office-Bolangir/2723/About-the-Organization/2", "archivedate": "30 July 2013"} Balangir municipality is divided into twenty one wards.  It is spread over an area of 12,200 acres (4,900 ha).[3]{"citetype": "web", "url": "http://www.ofbadmal.in/", "title": "Archived copy", "accessdate": "4 April 2013", "archiveurl": "https://web.archive.org/web/20130403091707/http://www.ofbadmal.in/", "archivedate": "3 April 2013"}

Geography
Balangir is located at 20°43′N 83°29′E﻿ / ﻿20.72°N 83.48°E﻿ / 20.72; 83.48.[5] It has an average elevation of 383 metres (800 feet) above sea level.

Airport
The Jharsuguda Airport at Jharsuguda is the nearest airport to the city while Swami Vivekananda Airport at Raipur, Chhattisgarh is 234 km away. Biju Patnaik International Airport in the state capital, Bhubaneswar is 327 km away by road and 397 km by rail.

Railway Station
Balangir Railway Station on the Jharsuguda-Sambalpur-Titlagarh railway line of East Coast Railways is the city's railway link to the national railway network.

Highway
Bolangir is connected by road to the state capital Bhubaneswar which is 327 km to the west.

Politics
Current MLA from Bolangir Assembly Constituency is Narasingha Mishra of Indian National Congress, who won the seat in State elections of 2014 by defeating BJD stalwart Ananga Udaya Singh Deo.
Bolangir is part of Bolangir (Lok Sabha constituency).{"citetype": "web", "url": "http://archive.eci.gov.in/se2000/background/S18/Orissa_AC_Dist_PC.pdf", "title": "Assembly Constituencies - Corresponding Districts and Parliamentary Constituencies of Odisha", "publisher": "Election Commission of India", "accessdate": "2008-09-26", "urlstatus": "dead", "archiveurl": "https://web.archive.org/web/20051108040424/http://archive.eci.gov.in/se2000/background/S18/Orissa_AC_Dist_PC.pdf", "archivedate": "2005-11-08"}
